e="preserve">Ming Cho Lee (; October 3, 1930 – October 23, 2020) was a Chinese-American theatrical set designer. He was a professor at the Yale School of Drama. He designed over 30 productions for Joseph Papp at The Public Theater, including the original Off-Broadway production of "Hair". He won a Drama Desk Award. In 1983, he won a Tony Award.
His best known works were "Mother Courage and Her Children", "King Lear", "The Glass Menagerie", "The Shadow Box," and "For Colored Girls Who Have Considered Suicide When the Rainbow Is Enuf".
Lee died on October 23, 2020 in New York City at the age of 90.
